reviews.text: This is a fine hotel and casino if you don't need a shuttle from the airport or don't want to see the strip. The shuttle from the airport runs at on 2 to 4 hour interval. If you in after 11am the next shuttle is not until 3pm. A taxi is about $50. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the strip in traffic and the shuttles to the strip are not very convenient either. The casino is veryu smoky and you have to go through it to get to the rooms. The rooms are very large and nice and I would consider them above average to excellent. If not for the terrible shuttle service I would have rated this hotel much higher. If you don't want to leave or have a vehicle this would be a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Not if you want to see Vegas

reviews.text: Though FAR off the strip, this hotel was nicely sized (you didn't get lost), clean and fairly new. It has a bowling alley and Bingo which begins on the odd hours. The 2 for 1 ice cream sundae's are HUGE so don't go unless you're up for a challenge. $2.00 craps was fun but the table was cold every time I played. Dealers mostly knew what they were doing but they didn't come across as overly friendly. Rooms are also HUGE as are the bathrooms. Nicely tiled floors, double sink area is separate from toilet and tub. If I wanted a casino experience without "The Strip" feel, I would check out the Suncoast again. Oh, and because it's in a suburban neighborhood, there are many local restaurants, shops and even grocery stores nearby.
reviews.title: This hotel exceeded my expectations

reviews.text: Hotel rooms in Las Vegas during the annual electronics show [CES] can be expensive and/or hard to find. I had been to the Suncoast before and it seemed like a decent place, so I booked it.
reviews.title: Good Location, Bad Location
This place smells!
reviews.text: It IS in fact located far from the Strip, but a bit closer to downtown. The only life near the place is the Marriott Regent hotel/casino and Angel Park golf course across the street. It is essentially an isolated island. If you don't have a car, you are ---.

reviews.title: Love the Suncoast
reviews.text: The good news about the location is that it is in a quiet, desert setting. Additionally, the clientelle seems to be a notch above what would be expected at some of the cheaper hotels and casinos downtown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here from October 12-18th. Excellent location, away from the hustle and bustle of the strip traffic. Great eating places around, shopping for ones who like to shop. One the greatest bingo halls ever.
reviews.title: Best Place Ever
Great 5 Day Vacation
reviews.text: I came her in April and won $46,080.00 playing bingo, came back this time and my husband won $1430.00 playing bingo and then won another $500.00 when they called his name on a raffle drawing.
Rooms are to die for, absolutely beautiful, had a wonderful view of the city, mountains and golf course.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Next door also in two other casinos to enjoy, and 5minutes away is the beautiful Red Rock Casino.
reviews.title: Decent Place To Stay

reviews.text: The slots are also nice to play, did not win a lot, but stayed alive and did not lose my shirt.
reviews.title: Not bad for an all-in-one.
more for your money!!!!!
reviews.text: I am sitting in my room at the Suncoast as I write this reveiw to you, via high speed internet service provided by the hotel at a $9.99 fee. ( a bargin since I probably saved $100 over the 24 hour period, by using my computer instead of gambling!!)

reviews.title: An excellent hotel not so far of Strip Las Vegas
reviews.text: Trip advisor is my travelers bible. I was surprised at any negative comments about the Suncoast, but most were positve witch steered me to give it a try.
We checked in Monday, Sept. 26 and will depart today Sept. 28.
reviews.title: Clean rooms but couldn't escape cigarette smoke

reviews.text: Since it is off season and during the week, we may have not experienced the heavey smoke ,bad service or disgrundled staff some have written about.
reviews.title: LOVED THE SUNCOAST

reviews.text: The rooms are huge, bathrooms gigantic, and the beds are heavenly.(must be a coast hotel trait, Barbary coast has same beds)
reviews.title: Never felt so deceived by reviews

reviews.text: I absolutely love this hotel! We stayed there last summer and it was perfect. It is about 20-25 mins. from the strip, but that was not a problem for us because we had our car. It's kinda small, only about 300 rooms, but that made it easy to get around. The pool is awesome!!! It's not too big...but it was NEVER crowded....and we were there in July when it was 105 degrees out! We got lunch delivered to the pool and the burgers and fries were great...just what we needed.
reviews.title: This place is great
big room, short on amenities
reviews.text: We ate breakfast at the buffet, and at the little cafe there (p.s. the brownies at the cafe are scrumptious and HUGE)...well worth the money. We never ate dinner at the hotel, as we were always out and about on the town. You have to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, it is right across the street in a shopping complex. It's yummy and they really do have the best cheesecake! We ate there 3 times (chicken madeira is my fave!).

We saw a movie at a theatre down Rampart Blvd...on the corner of Sahara (my sister used to live in Vegas...I have been there numerous times so I know my way around well), but we did not see a movie at the Suncoast, although we have heard it is nice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Very Off Strip

reviews.text: We had to go bowling....we did so the last night we were there at 2 AM just to say we went bowling at 2 AM! It was alot of fun....pretty crowded for the middle of a Thursday night! But still plenty of room for everyone.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet,reasonable

reviews.text: We checked out Studio 54 and OPM (been there numerous times....it is our favorite nightclub). Had a blast.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Suncoast during Labor Day weekend. The place is about 20 minutes from the Strip, but it was fine because we had a rental car. The place was sold out all weekend, so although I had requested a non-smoking room, by the time I checked in on Saturday, they only had smoking rooms left. Let me say, if you are not a smoker, being in a smoking room is really difficult! I know I'm in Vegas and all, but it doesn't mean I need to be around smoke in my own room! Well, they were able to switch us to a non-smoking room the next day which was great.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — I had to stay in a smoking room the first night

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, nothing spectacular, but it's clean and it has all the amentities you would want (pool, restaurants, casino, covered free parking).
reviews.title: Very nice stay

likes.liked: — large rooms with good bathroom layout

reviews.title: Decent Room, GREAT View....
reviews.text: We had breakfast at Cafe Sienna. The food was good and our waitress, Pearl, was a doll! She's a local, so she gave us all these tips around driving around the Strip.
We also had breakfast one morning at the Bagel Express which was good as well. Prices at all these places are reasonable.
reviews.title: Off Strip? Fine by me!
good stay- lots of amenities
reviews.text: The room was very spacious and it had 37" flat screen tv. My husband loved that.

I traveled with my husband and 3 kids ages 1, 3, and 5. After our experience I just had to write a review. We initially had trouble with our booking through travelocity and I had to have multiple conversations with the staff of the hotel and everyone I dealt with was nice and accommodating. So before I began my trip I already had a good feeling. January 29th, 2008 is when we checked in and were we ever in for a treat. At the desk when we gave our names, the clerk spoke to her boss standing nearby to let her know that a new guest had arrived and I heard the woman say, "Give them the suite." We were registered for a one bedroom so you would not believe how excited we were when we reached the double doors that led into our room. We opened the door to the most beautiful 2 bedroom suite!! This entire place was floor to ceiling windows looking out on the most beautiful views of the mountains and golf courses. The room had tvs everywhere, in each bathroom (along with phones). The tubs were deep and large with jacuzzi jets and a water jet for your neck. The showers were large and the master bath even had multiple heads with a variety of settings. I had 2 nozzle continually oscillating back and forth and you could adjust their speed and intensity. The furnishings were beautiful, all the wood dark and attractive and there was a bar that sat 8 people. We could not have been more excited and we had booked for 50 dollars. I did not want to leave, it was just so beautiful, especially during the day staring out at the panoramic view. Some people want to stay on the strip, this place was wonderful and seriously not more than a 10 minute drive from the strip and they have a free shuttle to take you there and pick you up. The casino downstairs was a nice size and I played a little down there also. i was continually amazed at how everyone I dealt with from the check in clerk to the woman I purchased my bingo game from were just consistently nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Just so you know, I saw the regular one bedrooms being cleaned and they looked of the same quality, but only smaller. I will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave...
FANTASTIC Hotel EXCELLENT Staff !!!
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last March and I have to say it is a really NICE place to stay! The staff are WONDERFUL and genuinely seem to care about what they do - I experienced nothing but pleasantness and professionalism while I was there. Its like the staff WANTED to be there and any request you had was no problem. ALL the staff from the front desk to the bartender make you feel like you MATTER there. I was VERY impressed at how professional and NICE everyone was while I stayed there. The rooms are AMAZING ! I have to mention the beds themselves - they were SO comfortable and the sheets were pure mmmmmmmmm!!! I have stayed in a lot of hotels but I have to say the beds in this particular hotel were AMAZING ! The sheets smelled CLEAN as well - that is a big thing to me. I plan on coming back this year and HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the great reviews about the Suncoast - we agree- you can't go wrong by staying here. When we arrived- the courteous desk agent advised us that the hotel was nearly full. She then announced " I have upgraded you to a suite at no extra charge to you".
reviews.title: Excellent accomodations - a great value for the money!

likes.liked: — clean, well-maintained property- plenty of parking, good restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! it certainly was our lucky day - our suite on the 10th floor was over 1000 sq. feet -floor to ceiling windows overlooking the mountains -a huge bathroom- 2 couches, etc.
reviews.title: An unexpected gem

reviews.text: We had breakfast in the buffet (which was pretty good and worth the $ 6.99 ) and a late night supper in the coffee shop which was also pretty good and not too expensive.
reviews.title: The Suncoast is a Great Place to Stay!

likes.liked: — Nice big rooms for a great price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though she has some years on her, this hotel is still a beautiful lady. The rooms are a really good size and very clean. Once again, we were given a room with the view of the roof but it was up high enough that we could see the mountains and the strip in the distance. The bathroom has a door between the shower and the sink so it accomodates two people at once. The beds were comfortable and our room had a couch that was nice to relax after a long day.
reviews.title: Still a beautiful lady

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the cafe, the buffet and the streakhouse and they were all very good.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem!

reviews.text: The staff of the hotel was wonderful. We were treated really well by everyone. The staff was not afraid to smile and went out of their way to be accomodating.
reviews.title: Okay but reeks of tobacco smell

reviews.text: We visit Las Vegas two or three times a year and I try a different hotel each time. This was one of my favorites and one that I would not mind trying again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not believe all of the amenities at this place. The room was spacious with a great view and flat screen tv. It is a ways away from the strip but they do provise a free shuttle service there and back as well as to the airport and back. After visiting the strip I was glad that we didn't stay on it. The major plus was the gaming, $5 tables, no where else in Vegas had it. I will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The Suncoast gives you excellent value for a bargain price !Often you can get a wonderful room for $50 : spacious, clean, with a comfortable king size bed & a large sized flatscreen TV on the wall. Casino is fun, with fairly loose video poker machines. I have found the hotel staff to be usually uniformy pleasant, helpful & courteous. The only drawback I have about the place is while the buffet & Italian restaurants are pretty good, the 24 hour coffee shop is decidedly mediocre-----only a couple of menu items are worth ordering. Otherwise, a great value for the buck !
reviews.title: Suncoast-----GREAT value for the $ !

reviews.text: We have family that lives near this hotel and have eaten at the cafe several times. We have always been pleased with the food and service in the cafe. On this trip we found ourselves in need a hotel room for 1 night. We choose the Suncoast because of the low price and close proximity to our family. When we arrived in the rooms I was so surprised at how lovely they were. They have possibly been remodeled recently. We had 2 rooms, one on the 3rd floor and one on the fourth floor. In comparision to most hotels the rooms were quite spacious. The rooms had large flat screen T.V's and granite countertops in the bathrooms. The bathroom was two rooms with the shower and toliet separate from the vanity and sink. The room included a iron and ironing board. On the downside no coffee maker in the room. Of the two rooms, the room facing the pool had very nice views and the room on the opposite side had a boring view.
reviews.title: Surprised at how lovely the rooms were!

reviews.text: The website I booked the room through gave us free breakfast in the buffet. I'm glad it was free because it was not very good! I would not eat there again.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money, but needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a decent stay here. I love the location -- nowhere near the Strip or Downtown (but you could get to either in 20 mins by car), close to Red Rock Canyon. What a treat to look out the window and see golf courses and mountains instead of more hotel towers and neon lights.
reviews.title: Not so nice.....

reviews.text: The room was huge, clean, nicely furnished, but (oddly) had very little light available at night. Floor to ceiling windows make it very bright and cheery by day, but there are just a few dim lamps in the room. Strange.
reviews.title: Nice Casino/Terrible Management
